alert.note: Alert for Northern Wasatch Front (Utah) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued May 02 at 2:20PM MDT until May 05 at 6:00PM MDT by NWS Saltlake
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Salt Lake City UT has issued a Flood Watch for the following rivers in Utah... The Lower Weber River At Plain City affecting Northern Wasatch Front zone. .Warm temperatures will melt snowpack and increase river flows. ...FLOOD WATCH FOR SNOWMELT IN EFFECT FROM THIS AFTERNOON TO FRIDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Near minor flooding is forecast. Increased flow greater than the forecast will result in minor flooding. * WHERE...The Lower Weber River At Plain City. * WHEN...From this afternoon to Friday evening. * IMPACTS...At 27.0 feet (4590 cfs), flooding will occur along the levee system near Plain City, affecting local farmland adjacent to the Weber River. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 12:45 PM MDT Tuesday the stage was 26.1 feet (4250 cfs). - Forecast...Flood stage may be reached based on the latest forecast information. Flows will oscillate diurnally, peaking during the early morning to the afternoon. Current peak forecast is 26.66ft (4445 cfs) around 1000 to 1300 MDT on Thursday, May 4, 2023. - Flood stage is 27.0 feet (4590 cfs). - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: If you are in the watch area, remain alert to possible flooding. Residents and those with interests near the river should monitor rising water levels and be prepared for possible flood warnings. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued on an as needed basis or by 1200 MDT on Wednesday, May 3, 2023.
